result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarrod W. Pitts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

4:07 p.m. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court.  Defendant states he was released from jail on February 2, 2017 - not working. Has a prospect in Rhinelander area. Will be staying with daughter in Rhinelander area. Defendant requests community service. Court encourages defendant to obtain employment - will consider community service at later time. Court approves monthly payments without payment plan. Adj. 4:11 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
from defendant's counsel requested Amended JOC - granted
to Amend Judgment of Conviction

4:20 p.m. Attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn in court appearing telephonically.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Schoenborn statement that defendant is in custody in Vilas County jail - does not know release date. Adj. 4:22 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for February 13, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:32 
Calling 15cf207 and 16cf151
State moves to dismiss 16cf151 in its entirety  - Granted - 
Plea questionnaire filed- No contest plea to 15cf207 as charged -   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty
Pfeifer/Schoenborn/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing
Court WHS  and POP for 3 years
Costs - $268 plus DNA surcharge $250 -   Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
AODA and recovery as recommended
130 days - huber for all purposes- 50 credit if revoked - - Court allows release and to commence this sentence by  9-23-16 at 4pm  must check in to probation today upon release - (being held on Vilas case - to report upon release from there) 
Submit DNA sample-   The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Appeal rights/voting rights provided to defendant - 
Costs due or payment plan to be set up by  -

10:29 a.m. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court, in custody, via video with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn. Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 16CF151. Schoenborn in receipt of complaint; speaks to bond modification. Court questions defendant on residence and transportation to court hrgs.; defendant states eligible to obtain driver's license. Pfeifer objects to modification. Defendant statement. Court statement--speaks to missed appearances. Court reduces cash bond to $500 each case.
Status conference on July 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:58 p.m. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court via video with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in custody.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf151 and 15cf207. Burns appearing specially for Attorney Bryce Schoenborn - Burns states Attorney Schoenborn has obtained date for pre-trial conference. Court does not see date in calendar. Pfeifer does not have any notes regarding preliminary hearing scheduled- has adjourned initial scheduled for June 30, 2016 on bail jumping charges. Bail continued. Adj. 3:02 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

1:20 Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court, in custody, via video.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brian Desmond appeared for State of Wisconsin in 12FA08. Calling 16cf151 and 15cf207 and 12 FA 08.   
In 16cf151- In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Court notes Attorney Bryce Schoenborne appointed in underlying matter - Pfeifer/Defendant statement to bail - 
In 15cf207, Defendant states attorney changed court date and he thought his date was May 26, 2016 - was on his way to court and called--was told he missed his date so he went back to work. Court sets $3,000 cash each of 16cf151 and 15cf207.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm in 16cf151; Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 2:30 pm. 
In 12FA08 - Court sets $5,000 signature bond. Next hearing on July 7, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 1- Desmond asks for current address in Michigan - Defendant states he does not have one - can use Oneida County Jail address. Desmond requests mailing addresses other than Oneida County Jail - Defendant states he receives mail at 435 Jasper Street, Iron River, MI or 5395 Pine Road, Land O Lakes, WI. Adj. 1:30 p.m.
Per Sara, ONSO - in Oneida County custody
per Sara @ ONSO - detainer - Iron County MI
extradition forecast

3:48 p.m. Attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Schoenborn was expecting defendant - does not know where defendant is located. State requests warrant. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 3:49 p.m.
Pre-trial conference on May 17, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

3:54 p.m. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Jodie Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schoenborn requests adjourned pre-trial - has not fully discussed State's recent offer with client - Bail continued. Adj. 3:55 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

3:27 p.m. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schoenborn in receipt of Information - waives further reading - enters not guilty plea. Bail continued. Adj. 3:29 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

3:39 p.m. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Oneida County Deputy Stetson Grant/sworn/direct by Michlig/ Witness ID's defendant / cross by Schoenborn. Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over. Court directs State to file Information within 30 days. Bail continued. Adj. 3:56 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant made voluntary - warrant not sent over to dispatch

3:31 p.m. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Schoenborn as to non-appearance--Schoenborn states that defendant did not have a ride for court appearance - contacted Schoenborn's office the afternoon of missed appearance. Court quashes warrant. Bednar statement to bond and to costs for preliminary hearing - Schoenborn statement to conversations with Michlig - Schoenborn requests new date for preliminary hearing. Bail continued. Adj. 3:35 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

9:42 a.m. Attorney Bryce Schoenborn in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schoenborn has no information to defendant's whereabouts.  State requests warrant - Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 9:43 a.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

1:26 P.M. Defendant Jarrod W. Pitts in court with attorney Bryce Schoenborn.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea - prelim time limits waived.
Bail continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea of Not Guilty and demand for 12 person jury
Adjourned initial appearance at 10-01-2015 01:15 pm
